channel.title: Learning With Sckinta
channel.description: Recent content on Learning With Sckinta

item.title: Network Analysis in R
item.description: Glossaries Create a graph From edge list From adjacent matrix From data.frame Create random graph Extract vertex and edge and their attributes vertex edges summarize graph statistics Degree and strength Distance Network analysis is to study the complexity of the inter-relationships between actors of all sorts and provides an architechural view of individual actor connections. It has been applied to many fields, like social network and gene network, and useful for any systematic studies on individual relationship.

item.title: About
item.description: Sckinta Chun, also known as Sckinta online, is a bioinformatics scientist at the Childrenâ€™s Hospital of Philadelphia, where she explores the influence of the molecular regulatory architecture on the genetic susceptibility for childhood diseases by analyzing genomics data. She completed her PhD in Biology at the University of Virginia, studying a family of parasitic plants that infect crops in Africa. She uses R extensively for statistical analysis and data visualization in her research.
